readableName: The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past

settings.name: goals
settings.description: Define your end goal for the game.

ganon: Find the crystals, defeat Agahnim in Ganon's Tower, then defeat Ganon
crystals: Find the crystals, then defeat Ganon
bosses: Clear every dungeon, then defeat Ganon
pedestal: Get the three Medallions, then pull the Master Sword from its pedestal
ganon_pedestal: Get the Medallions, check the Master Sword pedestal, then defeat Ganon
triforce_hunt: Find the Triforce Pieces, then find Murahdahla
local_triforce_hunt: Find the Triforce Pieces in your own world, then find Murahdahla
ganon_triforce_hunt: Find the Triforce Pieces, then defeat Ganon
local_ganon_triforce_hunt: Find the Triforce Pieces in your own world, then defeat Ganon
ice_rod_hunt: Start with everything but the Ice Rod; find it, defeat Trinexx at Turtle Rock, then find Murahdahla

settings.name: mode
settings.description: Define your starting point and base world.

settings.name: crystals_needed_for_gt
settings.description: How many crystals are required to access the Ganon's Tower entrance.

settings.name: crystals_needed_for_ganon
settings.description: How many crystals are required to defeat Ganon, if that is the goal. Irrelevant if it is not.

settings.name: triforce_pieces_required
settings.description: How many Triforce pieces will be required to complete your goal.

settings.name: triforce_pieces_mode
settings.description: This will determine how many extra Triforce Pieces, if any, there will be during your Triforce Hunt.

extra: The required number plus an extra amount
percentage: A certain percentage over the required number
available: A set number of Triforce pieces

settings.name: triforce_pieces_extra
settings.description: How many Triforce pieces will be available over the required amount.

settings.name: triforce_pieces_percentage
settings.description: What percentage of Triforce pieces over the required amount will be available. For instance, 20 pieces at 150% would result in 30 pieces in the game.

settings.name: triforce_pieces_available
settings.description: How many Triforce pieces will be available in the game, total. May not be lower than triforce_pieces_required.

settings.name: triforcehud
settings.description: Whether to hide the Triforce HUD display to start with during a Triforce Hunt

hide_goal: Hide the display until you pick up a Triforce piece or talk to Murahdahla
hide_required: Hide the goal number until you've talked to Murahdahla

settings.name: timer
settings.description: Set the timer option for the game. If set, the compass treasure counter will be disabled. One-hit KO lives here.

timed: counts up, collect clocks to bring it down
timed_countdown: counts down, collect clocks to push it up
timed_ohko: counts down; if it hits 0, one-hit KO mode is on
ohko: Screw the timer! Just gimme OHKO mode!

settings.name: countdown_start_time
settings.description: In countdown timer modes, the time in minutes the clock starts at.

settings.name: red_clock_time
settings.description: The amount of minutes awarded or subtracted by red clocks. Should be the lowest, but not required.

settings.name: blue_clock_time
settings.description: The amount of minutes awarded or subtracted by blue clocks. Should be the middle value, but not required.

settings.name: green_clock_time
settings.description: The amount of minutes awarded or subtracted by green clocks. Should be the highest, but not required.

settings.name: entrance_shuffle
settings.description: Affects how overworld entrances are arranged. Supercedes door shuffle.

crossed: Connectors can cross over Light/Dark World

settings.name: door_shuffle
settings.description: Shuffles supertiles within dungeons. Superceded by entrance shuffle.

settings.name: intensity
settings.description: How much of an effect Door Shuffle will have on the game.

settings.name: boss_shuffle
settings.description: Whether and how bosses will be shuffled.

basic: Shuffle all bosses except GT (one each)
singularity: Spawn one boss as much as possible

settings.name: misery_mire_medallion
settings.description: Which medallion is required to access Misery Mire entrance.

settings.name: turtle_rock_medallion
settings.description: Which medallion is required to access Turtle Rock Main entrance.

settings.name: bigkey_shuffle
settings.description: How big keys will be shuffled.

start_with: They will be in your inventory from the start
original_dungeon: Keep them to their own dungeons
own_dungeons: Put them in any dungeon in your world
own_world: Put them anywhere in your world
different_world: Put them in any world but yours

settings.name: smallkey_shuffle
settings.description: How small keys will be shuffled.

start_with: They will be in your inventory from the start
original_dungeon: Keep them to their own dungeons
own_dungeons: Put them in any dungeon in your world
own_world: Put them anywhere in your world
different_world: Put them in any world but yours
universal: any world, usable in any dungeon

settings.name: compass_shuffle
settings.description: How compasses will be shuffled.

start_with: They will be in your inventory from the start
original_dungeon: Keep them to their own dungeons
own_dungeons: Put them in any dungeon in your world
own_world: Put them anywhere in your world
different_world: Put them in any world but yours

settings.name: map_shuffle
settings.description: How maps will be shuffled.

start_with: They will be in your inventory from the start
original_dungeon: Keep them to their own dungeons
own_dungeons: Put them in any dungeon in your world
own_world: Put them anywhere in your world
different_world: Put them in any world but yours

settings.name: dungeon_counters
settings.description: Determines when to show an on-screen counter for dungeon items.

settings.name: item_pool
settings.description: Affects what items will be available in the item pool.

easy: Adds extras of progressive items and bottles
hard: 14 hearts, L2 mail, L3 sword, L2 shield, no silvers unless swordless
expert: 8 hearts, L1 mail, L2 sword, L1 shield, no silvers unless swordless

settings.name: item_functionality
settings.description: Affects how useful your items are, and how you're expected to use them.

easy: Use medallions anywhere, hammer can sub for Master Sword for Ganon and monoliths
hard: Less potion healing, can't catch faeries, 2Ã— Magic Cape mana cost, no Cane of Byrna invul, no Boomerang stun, no silvers except Ganon
expert: Hard mode, but even less potion healing and no Hookshot stun either

settings.name: glitches_required
settings.description: Whether progression may be locked behind checks that are out of logic.

minor_glitches: May require some of the easier glitches
hybrid_major_glitches: Requires some pretty intense glitch use, but nothing extreme

settings.name: glitch_boots
settings.description: If you're in a logic mode where you're expected to have Pegasus boots to glitch around, get those to start with.

settings.name: dark_room_logic
settings.description: Whether a light source should be required to traverse dark rooms.

lamp: Expect that you'll have a lamp for those
torches: A Fire Rod will do to light up braziers

settings.name: progressive
settings.description: If progressive items are on, you will always receive the next sword, shield, or mail upgrade. If not, you could get Gold Sword first, for instance.

grouped_random: Some groups may be while others may not

settings.name: swordless
settings.description: Whether you're expected to clear the game without using the sword. This changes a lot of things and makes the game A LOT harder, understandably.

settings.name: retro_bow
settings.description: This requires you to buy a quiver and pay rupees to shoot arrows.

settings.name: retro_caves
settings.description: This adds Take Any caves to the game.

settings.name: hints
settings.description: Whether hints about important items or difficult locations show up in the in-game hint system.

full: Every hint is good; no trolls

settings.name: scams
settings.description: Whether or not the vendors will tell you what they're selling, or just immediately take your money.

settings.name: restrict_dungeon_item_on_boss
settings.description: If enabled, the boss reward will never be a dungeon item such as a map or compass.

settings.name: killable_thieves
settings.description: Normally, the harmless but annoying thieves can only be knocked away. Turn on if you want to kill the jerks.

settings.name: enemy_shuffle
settings.description: Shuffle enemy positions. This does not include Hyrule Castle.

settings.name: enemy_damage
settings.description: Affects the amount of damage enemies inflict.

shuffled: General same number of hard hitters

settings.name: enemy_health
settings.description: Affects the amount of health enemies have.

settings.name: beemizer_total_chance
settings.description: Percentage of garbage treasures, like small rupees, bombs, and arrows, to be replaced with bees or bee traps.

settings.name: beemizer_trap_chance
settings.description: Percentage of bee checks which will become bee swarm traps instead of single bees.

settings.name: key_drop_shuffle
settings.description: Whether enemies that usually drop small keys will be shuffled.

settings.name: pot_shuffle
settings.description: Whether keys and buttons under pots will be shuffled within their supertiles.

settings.name: bush_shuffle
settings.description: Whether enemies and traps are hiding under different bushes.

settings.name: tile_shuffle
settings.description: Whether trap tile rooms will come out in different patterns.

settings.name: shuffle_prizes
settings.description: Whether certain events will yield different item drops than normal.

g: Prizes for killing enemies and the like
b: Prizes for bonking trees, stacks, etc.

settings.name: shop_shuffle
settings.description: Whether certain aspects of the shop will be randomized.

u: Adds those to general item pool
pP: Sometimes pay in bombs, arrows, and hearts
values.wfpP: Full exotic shuffle including potion shop

settings.name: shop_item_slots
settings.description: How many collectible/dungeon items will show up in shops. For each one, a 50rp. collectible is added to the item pool.

settings.name: shop_price_modifier
settings.description: Affects the price of collectible items in shops.

settings.name: ow_palettes
settings.description: How the overworld will look.

dizzy: Full random but keep saturation and lightness
puke: Completely random without regard to anything

settings.name: uw_palettes
settings.description: How dungeons and caves will look.

dizzy: Full random but keep saturation and lightness
puke: Completely random without regard to anything

settings.name: hud_palettes
settings.description: How the HUD will look.

dizzy: Full random but keep saturation and lightness
puke: Completely random without regard to anything

settings.name: sword_palettes
settings.description: How your swords will look.

dizzy: Full random but keep saturation and lightness
puke: Completely random without regard to anything

settings.name: shield_palettes
settings.description: How your shields will look.

dizzy: Full random but keep saturation and lightness
puke: Completely random without regard to anything

settings.name: link_palettes
settings.description: How Link will look. May or may not work with alternate sprites.

dizzy: Full random but keep saturation and lightness
puke: Completely random without regard to anything

settings.name: heartbeep
settings.description: How frequently the game will beep at you for low health.

settings.name: heartcolor
settings.description: The color of hearts in the HUD. This is based on palette positions, so colors may change if HUD palettes are shuffled.

settings.name: menuspeed
settings.description: How quickly the pause menu will slide in and out when you press Start.

settings.name: quickswap
settings.description: Whether you can use the L and R buttons to cycle through use items.

settings.name: reduceflashing
settings.description: Games of this era had a lot of blinking lights that could possibly trigger seizures. This will remove most of them. Essential if you're streaming.

settings.name: music
settings.description: Whether to play music. If disabled, this also turns off MSU-1 patches. If you're streaming and turning this off to play your own music, please be mindful of licensing.

settings.name: allow_collect
settings.description: If this is enabled, chests that have been `!collect`ed will be automatically opened. If you are playing on console, leave this off; this can make the game crash.

settings.name: sprite
settings.description: Your hero's sprite. Sorry there are no pictures; this is being done in a very hacky way to begin with. ZSPR files are hard. There's a pretty good reference on the [ALTTPR website](https://alttpr.com/en/sprite_preview).
